definition: not stick to/not confine oneself to/whatever
to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible

sentences.english: Try to discourage such familiarities from your subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓下屬對你這樣不拘禮節。

sentences.english: Try to discourage such familiarities from your subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓屬下對你這樣不拘禮儀。

sentences.english: I would like to have had the uniform off although I did not care much about the outward forms.
sentences.chinese: 我是不拘外表形式的，但我倒很想把這軍裝脫掉。

sentences.english: Gorbachev has pursued some more eclectic interests as well.
sentences.chinese: 此外，戈爾巴喬夫的興趣可謂不拘一格。

sentences.english: They were received without ceremony, ie informally.
sentences.chinese: 他們受到不拘禮節的歡迎。

sentences.english: Magda: Please excuse Kel, Rocky. He's got no manners.
sentences.chinese: 羅基，請原諒卡爾好嗎？他實在是有些不拘小節。

sentences.english: Be " guy " an informal sort of word?
sentences.chinese: 是一種隨便不拘禮節的詞嗎？

sentences.english: It is nice to see someone dressing differently.
sentences.chinese: 看到有人穿着不拘一格固然是好事。

sentences.english: It's wonderful to let your hair down at the weekend after you've been working hard all week.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦工作一週後在週末不拘禮節輕鬆一下真是太好了。

sentences.english: Here informal goings and comings are not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，不允許有不拘禮節的來往。

sentences.english: He walked along with the free-and-easy stride that Bertha so much admired.
sentences.chinese: 他用伯莎所極爲欣賞的那種不拘形式的大步往前走去。

sentences.english: His informal minor performances, drove all the unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 他那不拘小節的表演會驅趕所有的不快。

sentences.english: Mr Ma's approach to running the company is similarly independent.
sentences.chinese: 馬雲管理公司的方式也同樣不拘一格。

sentences.english: Is"guy" an informal sort of word?
sentences.chinese: 是一種隨便不拘禮節的詞嗎？

sentences.english: There was no ceremony about dining.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏喫飯可以不拘禮節。
是的，我們很不拘小節的。

definition: to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
to hold tight/to cling to/to adhere/stubborn/to detain sb as prisoner
to have a style of one's own
forms of versification/conventions regarding set number of words and lines, choice of tonal patterns and rhyme schemes for various types of Classical Chinese poetic composition/metrical verse
to decide/to determine/established practice/(dialect) firmly resolved (to do sth)
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
